drupalNodeEvent.title: US Election Results and Implications for Taiwan: A One Month Assessment

field_speakers.processed: Sarah Trister (Senior Foreign Policy Advisor, Senator Edward Markey (D-MA)), Robert Sutter (Professor of Practice of International Affairs, George Washington University), Hung-jen Wang (Associate Professor at National Cheng Kung University in Tainan), and Lev Nachman (Visiting Scholar at National Taiwan University in Taipei). Moderated by Deepa Ollapally (Associate Director of the Sigur Center for Asian Studies)

field_description.processed:
What does a change of guard in Washington mean for the special US-Taiwan relationship? What issues are at stake and how are they likely to be impacted by a Biden administration versus a Trump administration?

Join the Sigur Center for Asian Studies for a discussion with influential experts in the US and Taiwan for their perspectives on what we can expect as we look ahead to the next four years on topics from cross-Strait relations, US-Taiwan free trade agreement, and post-pandemic recovery. The event will feature an extensive period for audience Q&A.

Registration closes at 1pm EST on Tuesday, December 8.

This event is on the record, open to the public, and will be recorded. Advance questions are strongly encouraged and can be submitted to gsigur@gwu.edu with subject "Taiwan Roundtable Q&A."

More info on the registration page.
